challenges.title: Integers in the Real World
description: There are many excellent examples of our every day encounter with integers.
For example, I enjoy hiking up the mountains.  Did you know that you can meet integers while hiking?
As you are hike up the mountain, you are traveling in positive direction of integer.

When you descend, you are going negative direction of integer. Negative numbers are denoted with minus sign ( - ) infront of it. For positive integers, there is no need to put plus sign ( + ) in front of it.
Let's take look at some examples of integers: -2, -1, 0, 1, 2
Here is your challenge:  When you are going down the stairs which direction are you traveling on integer?  Pick one: Negative or Postive?
tests: assert(negative)/g.test(expression), 'message: The please pick one: negative or positive.')
